title: Standard Form of Hyperbola
text: The standard form for hyperbola is either $$\frac{{\left(x-h\right)}^2}{a^2}-\frac{{\left(y-k\right)}^2}{b^2}=1$$\nor $$\frac{{\left(y-k\right)}^2}{a^2}-\frac{{\left(x-h\right)}^2}{b^2}=1$$ depending on the transverse axis.
speech: The standard form for hyperbola is either  fraction, parentheses x minus h,  squared, over, a squared,  minus fraction, parentheses y minus k,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1 \nor  fraction, parentheses y minus k,  squared, over, a squared,  minus fraction, parentheses x minus h,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1  depending on the transverse axis.
pacedSpeech: The standard form for hyperbola is either   fraction,  x minus h,  squared, over, a squared,  minus fraction,  y minus k,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1
or   fraction,  y minus k,  squared, over, a squared,  minus fraction,  x minus h,  squared, over, b squared,  is equal to 1

title: Manipulating the Equation
text: If we are not able to tell directly whether an equation is a hyperbola using properties of the equation, we can attempt to force out a similar form to check.
speech: If we are not able to tell directly whether an equation is a hyperbola using properties of the equation, we can attempt to force out a similar form to check.
pacedSpeech: If we are not able to tell directly whether an equation is a hyperbola using properties of the equation, we can attempt to force out a similar form to check.

title: Manipulating the Equation
text: We would want to make the RHS $$1$$. We can do so by dividing the equation by $$400$$ on both side.
speech: We would want to make the RHS  1 . We can do so by dividing the equation by  400,  on both side.
pacedSpeech: We would want to make the RHS   1
. We can do so by dividing the equation by   400,

title: Manipulating the Equation
text: We observe that there is no coefficient on the numerator. This tells us we should remove the coefficient of $$x^2$$ and $$y^2$$. We can do so by dividing the denominator by the coefficient. We would thus divide $$400$$ by $$25$$ for the $$x^2$$ term and divide $$400$$ by $$16$$ for the $$y^2$$ term. What is the current expression?
speech: We observe that there is no coefficient on the numerator. This tells us we should remove the coefficient of  x squared  and  y squared . We can do so by dividing the denominator by the coefficient. We would thus divide  400  by  25  for the  x squared  term and divide  400  by  16  for the  y squared  term. What is the current expression?
pacedSpeech: We observe that there is no coefficient on the numerator. This tells us we should remove the coefficient of   x squared
. We can do so by dividing the denominator by the coefficient. We would thus divide   400
term. What is the current expression?

title: Squaring
text: We observe that the equation we found has the form of a hyperbola. We want to square the denominator to get a and $$b$$ so that we can express in the standard form.
speech: We observe that the equation we found has the form of a hyperbola. We want to square the denominator to get a and  b  so that we can express in the standard form.

so that we can express in the standard form.
